content.description:
This is a fairly satisfying climb with a variety of holds. The start may be the most difficult part, where feet positioning can make all the difference. Since half of it is a traverse, easier variations of the climb can be created by simply starting somewhere in the middle of the route. The climb isn't very tall, and the top out is flat and comfortable.

People have definitely at least climbed portions of this route (there are other videos online), but I haven't found an official name or description.
content.protection: The inside of the cave is too small for a spotter, so a crash pad to cover exposed rocks really helps. Outside of the cave, a spotter or crash pad can be used.
content.location: Sit start within the cave on one or both of the two edges. Traverse out to the left and top out on the flat area.

content.description: Begin towards the bottom of the left edge of the Hobo Cave boulder.  Climb up to the right along the edge and top out.
content.location: Starts at the bottom left corner of the boulder next to the tree.

content.description: Right arete of the boulder, start on the obvious jug. Pretty easy climbing and flows decently well but the trash you have to traverse around to start the climb detracts from the experience.
content.location: Behind the hobo cave near the river.

content.description: Sit start on the large jug rail at the bottom left of the boulder near the water. Make your way up through crimps, then exit to the left of the tree. Careful with the topout, it's not hard but you can't really protect it and will end up in the drink if you slip.
content.location: On the backside of the Hobo Cave.

content.description: The best line on this face. SDS on an obvious large rail  and make your way up and slightly right to the horn on big positive crimps and slopers.There is an alternate line I climbed where you start a little more to the right and squat start on the two lowest crimps. Goes at around V2 but really only changes the first move or two.
content.location: Behind the hobo cave boulder right next to the river there is a climbable face with a decent landing. I was tipped off to this lesser known spot and had to check it out - super solid climbing for NWB on clean holds.

content.description: A small cave formation with a flat top out area around 8 ft tall.
